website_summaries.verdict: The Logitech Harmony 1100 is an excellent touch-screen universal remote that corrects most of the shortcomings and frustrations of its predecessor, but its high price will relegate it to high-end home theaters only.
pros: Tablet-style, touch-screen, universal remote that controls 15 devices
controls components via infrared or RF (for an extra charge)
includes rechargeable battery and docking station
Web-programmable and compatible with Windows and Macintosh PCs via simple, straightforward software wizard
less expensive than competing tablet models
faster response time and improved operation versus Harmony 1000
cons: Pricey, especially considering that the RF module costs extra
screen drains battery quickly when it's not left in the charging stand
no easy way to use in more than one room
lacks the design and programming flexibility (you can't design your own buttons, custom screen layouts, or program multi-device macros) that many high-end remotes offer
setting up systems with more than five or six components can get pretty tricky

customer_reviews.title: Great remote...
customer_reviews.text: .... until the touchscreen no longer senses your touch! :-( This is the greatest remote control of all time! with infrared and radio frequency capabilities. I design my A/V closet around this remote. Now, to replace the remote, the newer models require an infrared blaster be installed on the outside of the A/V closet instead of the infrared emitter being part of the remotes. The Harmony 1100 had it all and it seemed to be designed by engineers that liked form and function, not just trying to meet some checklist of capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: R. Feldmeier

customer_reviews.title: This is a very useful universal remote control
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful universal remote control, we used for TV, Home theater, Stereo, indoors and outdoors commands. I bought for my parents, who live in a huge house of around 10,000ft2 construction and 80,0000ft land. This universal control was controlling nearly everything related to Image, Sound and Internet. Though it is really efficient, it is not so simple to set it and instructions were a bit complicated, we had to hire someone to set it as we wanted, and who taught us how to re-programme if needed. Otherwise, it is very simple to use once the programming is done.
customer_reviews.author: cnin

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 1100 - last remote you will ever need!
customer_reviews.text: Got this because my wife was beyond frustrated struggling with multiple remotes. Setup and programming takes some time and research and the software is not exactly straightforward but once you tweak it, you are good to go. One push of a button will turn on all the pertinent devices, set the inputs and even change sub-settings. I did not have any problem locating all the components and brands in my entertainment set-up. My wife is beyond amazed now that she only has to push a single button to watch TV, to play Blu-Ray or to listen to digital music. We put away all the other remotes as we no longer need them. This was the answer to our problem!
customer_reviews.author: Dean and Dana

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. And its a very fancy piece to have in your living room
customer_reviews.text: I just loved this one. After programmed, its amazing how it can turn on and off everything, have pictures for your favorite channels, etc. The only con here is that its not that easy to program. Im an IT guy and expert on programming and it was a bit confusing to make its work like I wanted to. Of course I have 7 devices on the living, one of them is a PC that I attached an IR sensor to it and made this command the PC. AWESOME. It take you some time to program everything, but after that, you can make magic with it, changing channels, input, muting the TV, changing video 1,2, 3 on my onkyo, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Claudio Albero

customer_reviews.title: It's not perfect - and that's an understatement.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote along with the RF Wireless Extender recently. I have items behind cabinet doors hence the need for the RF Extender. Let me just say that it is VERY succeptible to interference. I don't know the culpret but be advised - it will only work if your environment is really sterile - with regard to frequency interference. I now use the remotes that came with the individual components while I try and get to the root of the problem. I have spent hours and hours so far on this and from what I can determine those of us with similar problems could populate a small country.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo

customer_reviews.title: Updated review of Logitech Harmony 1100 Universal Remote
customer_reviews.text: My initial reaction to the Harmony 1100 remote was somewhat reserved. I was having trouble controlling my system and was not sure whether it was the remote or some other aspect. There was some of both. An email to the Logitech tech support group resulted in a change in the button assignments of the H1100 which helped my application a lot. Further investigation of the problems I was having finally pointed to the IR extender, not the remote. When the IR extender issue was resolved we became happy users of the H1100 and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blair

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good!!
customer_reviews.text: I received my new Harmony remote a few weeks ago and had it installed and running my equipment in 30 minutes. My wife has always complained about using 3 different remotes to watch a movie or television. We gave this one a try and it has performed very well. I am still working on customizing it for our needs but the basic features work very well. I read several reviews before purchasing and most were positive so I jumped in. This is the first universal remote I have owned and am very happy with the purchase. More imporantly, my wife is happy with a single remote for her needs.
customer_reviews.author: DaveBeck

customer_reviews.title: So easy, even a caveman can use it
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several universal remotes before, but I always need my husband or one of my sons to get me out of mistakes I make when I push the wrong button and can't figure out how to get out of it. This Logitech with its Touch Screen is so easy to use, even I can. Its attractive design and recharger keeps it neatly stored off the couch and coffee table until someone wants to watch something. I got this remote as a gift for my husband because he likes everything "tech-y," but I LOVE it because now I can watch cable, TiVo or a DVD even if no one's in the house but me.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: can't get along without it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great product, I don't think I could manage five remotes without it. I brought mine on Oct. 2009, and I must admit it was a longer learning curve, but was well worth it. I can't say about Cust. support because I didn't need it. It's really easy to figure out. The best part is your computer stores all the data you program into the remote, and if it should ever loose its way, just plug it into your computer via USB and update the remote with only one click...I love It..Update Feb 2012...still couldn't get by without it
customer_reviews.author: Islander

customer_reviews.title: A great remote but a bit to complicated for me.
customer_reviews.text: A great, easy to program remote. I love Harmony's and would give it more stars but personally I prefer the simplier Harmony 650 which can be used one handed and you do not need to look at. Also my fingers are too big for some of the on screen buttons. I am sure it is worth every dime to those into programable remotes and don't mind using both hands.
customer_reviews.author: Osmer Batcheller

customer_reviews.title: Junk and outdated !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and it worked about 40 minutes, programming was not fun and took way too much time. For the price technology has passed this by and there are many other options. I bought a L5 Remote here on Amazon for far less and turned my iTouch into a remote that KILLS this hunk of total junk. Funny but.... You can actually buy an L5 Remote and an iTouch for less than this boat anchor and have an iTouch for whatever else you want to use it for. Not recommended and a don't buy in any situation.
customer_reviews.author: Friggen Xanadu

customer_reviews.title: A little difficult to program
customer_reviews.text: The Harmony 100 is not as easy to program as indicated, but it is a good universal remote. Most useful is the large touch screen, which is a little tricky to engage for the devices using the corner touch points. It did "lose" it's device settings for the one touch functions on several occasions, so I mainly use it now for just the device controls. It really can control many. All in all, it is not bad, but a little pricey and hard to configure, which is why I only gave it 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: STEVE

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Logitech has changed the way I use and look at remotes. This has replaced all my remotes along with giving me more than the basic operation of each remote it replaced. It is pricey, but if you can swing it, it is more than worth it. For what it's worth, Amazon is around $50 cheaper than the box stores. I scored it a 4 in value due to feeling it is a little overpriced. I didn't rate Logitech's customer service due to not having used it. Setup is beyond simple, but I have seen pretty good feedback from other post's.
customer_reviews.author: stl73

customer_reviews.title: Simple to program atctivity based remote
customer_reviews.text: I had a Phillips Proto TU7000 universal remote that recently died. I bought this as a replacement as it was activity based and could be programed to work similarly to my old Pronto. It took less than an hour to setup for my Pioneer TV, Comcast DVR, Denon Receiver, and my custom built Windows HTPC. All the prebuilt controls for these devices worked right out of the gate and my non techie wife loves it. If she’s happy with it I certainly am.
customer_reviews.author: BigAl43

customer_reviews.title: Great remote
customer_reviews.text: I had a Harmony 1000 and it lasted about 5 years. The newer 1100 model looks the same, but has a few more features than the 1000 model. The only problem I have with the system is the inability to pre-program more channels into the unit and the inability to have icons for the popular channels. Otherwise, it's great! I really love the RF feature, although it's sold separately. It enables you to hide the equipment and still have full functionalbility of the remote.
customer_reviews.author: James Dickey

customer_reviews.title: One sweet remote
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my totally electronically inept uncle. If you can read and use a computer this thing is a piece of cake to set up. Works great and can be used for literally anything in your home that uses a remote. With some of the add on products it can be used with things that are not remote controlled like lights. There is even an add on system and smart phone app to be able to control your lights and other things when you're not home. Simply awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Easy to program - Slow to respond
customer_reviews.text: I give this unit 4 stars - could have been 5. Programming was pretty simple except for Netflix . The unit wanted to play a disc refusing the WiFi function in the Blue Ray player. Finally got it programmed. The down side - From the time you press a command it takes way too long for the components to turn on to give you the function you asked for. EG. Play a movie - watch TV - access Netflix etc. Nice feel to the master controller seems to run forever before recharging.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Fancy & fun
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted this remote for years. I've used several of the Logitech remotes and always was impressed. I was a little skeptical like others because of the square design, its not a one hand remote. I pulled the trigger though and couldn't be happier. Set up was easy (or just as easy as any other logitech remote). Takes a bit of time setting it up and fine tuning, but once you get it set up all is good. Treat yo'self!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks, but it's the only thing that will do ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks, but it's the only thing that will do what I need without giving tons of money to a commercial IR vendor. The USB connection is complete bulls***, it fails frequently on linux, mac OS and windows, but it works often enough to make it part of my home theater. Sometimes I wish I bent over and gave it all to creston. dammit.
customer_reviews.author: John N. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good remote but too Expensive
customer_reviews.text: I really like this remote. I broke my first one so bought it again mainly because it works and I had all the programing already done. I did not want to spend a lot of time setting up a second remote. I have the wireless extender which works great because I can keep the doors closed and my equipment out of sight. If you like the look of this unique remote and do not mind spending some time programming it you will love it. My main complaint is that it is way too expensive for what you get. If this remote was around $250 I would have given it another star.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby & Selina Bliven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent remote
customer_reviews.text: This is my best universal remote I have tried. I have harmony one and other universals but this is the best. The only downside is inability to operate it with 1 hand or I should say is very difficult to operate it with one hand. Configuring it with logitech software is easy and support for devices is very good on their site. This has worked very good for me and continues to perform very well.
customer_reviews.author: ddywz

customer_reviews.title: With perseverance. . .
customer_reviews.text: When I got my first Harmony 1100, nothing worked correctly. Version 7.7 of the software was incompatible with Mac Ox 10.7, the unit would not communicate with my Macbook Air, troubleshooting was useless, and even tech support could not get it up to work properly. So I sent it to Amazon for a replacement. Today after less than 60 minutes including one call to tech support that included a tutorial on customization, it now works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S. Mintz

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite toys
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit of a techie so I have a lot of components attached to my A/V system got so sick of having to reach for 4 different remotes just to watch a dvd or play a game or simply watch tv so i picked this up and solved that issue immediately. only bad point is that it is nearly impossible to use without looking down at it. Theres no way to familiarize yourself with the touch screen to give commands without looking down (i always press the wrong button) at it like i used to with my satellite remote but o well
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Touch Screen will stop working
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a few years ago (before the price dropped) and with all the add on parts I've spent over $700 on it. Recently the touch screen got a little flaky but still worked. so I contacted support and followed his instructions, which bricked my remote. It is useless now. And they said "Oh. Sorry. Tough luck. Buy a new one." I urge you NOT TO BUY THIS unless you want to buy it several times as I have had to.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love It !
customer_reviews.text: Ibought this remote because my wife has trouble using our home theater. The remote arrived on time and in good condition. The programming instructions were not entirely clear, but I got the remote and RF extender programmed. After the programming was completed, the remote is very easy to use. My wife now has no problems doing anything that she wants to do with our home theater. Highly Recommended !!
customer_reviews.author: John A Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: OLD SOFTWARE; DEAD BATTERY
customer_reviews.text: IF YOU HAVE A LATE-MODEL MAC I.E. > OSX 9.0, YOU'LL HAVE TO DOWNLOAD LOGITECH'S 7.9.0 SOFTWARE, BECAUSE AMAZON APPARENTLY SELLS OLD EQUIPMENT WITH TWO GENERATIONS-OLD SOFTWARE. IN MY CASE, THE BATTERY REFUSED TO CHARGE AS WELL. LOGITECH WILL NOT SUPPORT AMAZON PURCHASES, SO IF YOU HAVE A CONNECTIVITY PROBLEM AS I DID, YOU'LL HAVE TO RETURN IT TO AMAZON AND WAIT FOR A REPLACEMEMT. BUT DON'T WAIT TOO LONG: AMAZON WON'T ACCEPT A RETURN AFTER 30 DAYS.
customer_reviews.author: RBL

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to do
customer_reviews.text: If you got the money to spend on a REMOTE, do it on this one. Controls my entire home theater system with the exception of my PS3 and is fully customizable. You can program individual buttons from any remote and transfer the action to your harmony control. Love it and it looks frickin sweet on my side table. Bye bye 6 remotes, hello 1 awesome remote. Only reason I docked it was because the darn thing is expensive but it does appeal to a specific group of people/enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: This is not American Made
customer_reviews.text: I have a home theater system that was set up using this remote which I did like very much. To save a major revision of my system I ordered the same remote online. It was difficult to to program to my system and works poorly most of the time. It makes noises my other remote did not make. This is definitely not the american product from Logitech. I know I will have to replace it in the not to distant future.
customer_reviews.author: ARK

customer_reviews.title: A great convenience as long as you don't need to program it.
customer_reviews.text: A great device though the programming is inconvenient, requiring a rather slow process of adding buttons one by one with no batch capability and is difficult to charge at times.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Better than the current Touch
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT remote. Its one of the older Logitech remotes but its still top of the line in my opinion. Its way better than the current Logitech Touch remotes, I have two of them. Its very reliable and only needs to be charged about once a week with medium usage. The touch on the other hand will last maybe three days. Like I said, this is a great remote for your home theater.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Defective.
customer_reviews.text: This did not come with the original USB cord. So I tried every USB cord and it still did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but the Logitech's product managers shouldn't be left without adult supervision
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice remote. But it doesn't do macros/sequences; you know, where you have one button do two things (e.g. "Turn on Zone 2; set Input for Zone 2 to input X"). This is dumb. Because it CAN do something similar as part of the power-on sequence, but the people who decide features sets at Logitech seem totally unaware of what people do with their products, which is why they shouldn't be allowed to do anything without approval from a grown-up.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm A. C. Weir

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $$$$$
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to spend this kind of money on a remote ,but with all the advanced features of todays electronics a $20 universal remote is out of the question. This was the easiest thing to set up. Just plug it in and select your devices on your pc and boom done. All the buttons were there , I didnt even have to modify anything. I called logitech once to help me set up activites but they were top notch and that took minutes. I have my 1100 controlling: Bravia 3D LED PS3 XBOX360 Pioneer Elite Receiver Buttkicker Seagate Goflex TV Toshiba HDDVD Fios Box
customer_reviews.author: audiowylde23

customer_reviews.title: Great remote. Can program pretty much any function for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great remote. Can program pretty much any function for any device I could own. Little bit of lag on occasion between giving a command and the device responding to it. Overall I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Great remote!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Harmony remote and by far the best one I've owned due to it's RF capabilities. It replaced my Harmony ONE (which is now used in the family room) and could not be more pleased. I'm glad that it does not have the glossy finish like the harmony one which is a finger print magnet. The only down fall if any, is that the battery live is short and definitely needs to be charged on its dock every night.
customer_reviews.author: Derick1105

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: impossible to install unless you are a professional. Had trouble with it working consistently. It's a complicated device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This had to be returned as it didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I sent this back because it didn't work at all. I had the earlier version and this was to replace that as it had finally, after several years of faithful service, died. After sending it back I discovered an alternate remote system but I presume if it had worked it would have been at least as good as the last model which was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lord

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: If you have ever had to play around with 4 or 5 different remotes to turn on your TV or your tuner or a DVD player or . . . just get this wonderful device and your troubles and hassles go away. As I mentioned in an earlier review, it sees that Logitech corrected all of the mistakes they made with the Logitech 1000 and, with that knowledge, created this gem. Do yourself a favor and get this product.
customer_reviews.author: David Marker

customer_reviews.title: Great controller
customer_reviews.text: I have a Logitech Harmony 900 which I thought was great, wow, the 1100 is even better. Easy to setup and had it working in minutes. The hardest part was getting all of the required model numbers. I was suprised that the Harmony remote even recognized my wife's old VCR and control's it like all of my other new equipment. I'm very happy and satisified with my new controller!!
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Great product/ akward to hold
customer_reviews.text: The remote works really well. It does everything that I want and more. The only negative comment is that it requires two hands to operatate and hold. The remote also has an area to store pictures and look at them as a slide show. I think the remote should show the pictures when it is in the charger. That would be an easy cheap feature.
customer_reviews.author: Just A Guy

customer_reviews.title: EASY to set up
customer_reviews.text: Just love this remote. It is the best universal remote in terms of setting up and learning. The activities function works (most of the time) like a charm. Only gave it four stars for I had to replace it after two years. But I got the exact same remote which was on sale at the time when the screen cracked and would not accept my commands.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: He still loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband - who is a person that is hard to buy for. He loved it and still does. I bought this about 5 years ago and it is still working like the first day - we've only had to replace the batteries. I'm sure there's a new & improved model, but if you're looking for a gift for a Father's Day gift, this would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: D. Moseley

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 1100 Remote
customer_reviews.text: The remote was easy to set up. Love the bigger screen. Easier to see without using my reading glasses. only con is I could not transfer all my settings from my Harmony 980. Had one glitch, the screen flipped upside down and the touch panel would not do what you wanted. I just removed the battery and put it back in a few seconds later and everything was good again. Only happened once. So far I love it.
customer_reviews.author: CPTuell

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Great remote.
customer_reviews.text: The best remote I've ever owned. Bought them brand new. Bought 2 of them. Excellent quality remote for the money. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike. P

customer_reviews.title: Really nice looking
customer_reviews.text: The remote is really cool. It makes for a great conversation piece It works well once programmed Like other reviewers with dvrs however it's really not easy enough to fast forward and rewind. It needs a few programmable hard keys and it would be the ultimate remote.
customer_reviews.author: Coldwatergardens

customer_reviews.title: One remote that replaces many/any
customer_reviews.text: Quite simpley this is the only remote sold, at this price point, that controls everything. Logitech set out to compete with the big boys. It not only works with All AV equipment, it also is comparable with home automation devices! The color display's not new, just improved! The charging station is flawless too. It's a little higher priced, but not $1,200 for similar items...
customer_reviews.author: ToddBuf

customer_reviews.title: Harmony remotes are amazing, this one is a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I have other (less expensive) Harmony remotes. They are amazing; the user interface is fantastic, they work very well, etc. Because I love the Harmony remotes and trust the brand I invested in this most premium unit. This remote does not meet expectations. The "customizable screen" is harder to use to access the buttons you use most vs. one of the handheld remotes, and the ergonomics make it very difficult to use without two hands. It is also more than double the price of the other Harmony remotes which are better to use. Not worth the money--let me make that mistake for you.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Great! so easy to understand!
customer_reviews.text: i orderd this just wanting to be high tech and have 1 simple remote. It was a breeze to set up and edit. I had a question on what one thing would be considered but one call to a friend and that was fixed. Even my mom (who can't work a computer) loves this remote and finds it very easy. The touchscreen is easy to use and understand. the start up time does take a little bit after every component is turned on until you can us th remote but no problem. defiantly recommend this product. is kinda pricey though. *WORKS WITH MAC YAY*
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this so my wife would be able to use instead of the five remotes previously used. Some folks said it would not work with Apple TV. I had no problems. A bit tedious to set up. Initial set up under 30 mins but took another 30+ mins to "fine tune" buttons so could use all features of different devices.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Freakin awesome
customer_reviews.text: This remote completely revamped the way I use my home entertainment. I have an HDTV, Surround sound, Xbox, blu ray, computer, and Dish box and this thing put them all together for me. Pretty easy set up if your even semi electronically inclined. Easy customization letting you do almost anything with one button. Before buying check the Logitech website for compatibility for your devices just to be sure other than that pony up to get the best remote out there.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I had a Sony Commander for a number of years that controlled my home theater system. I finally gave up and honestly, i didn't know what I was missing. This product does everything the commander did only better. The programing via my computer was easy with the wizard and worked with only 1 minor tweak. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Callen

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 1100
customer_reviews.text: I love the one button touch system so that now my wife can watch TV or a DVD without having to go through a whole bunch of steps. It is a little difficult to program properly, but once done is a joy to use. I did have to call support to get it properly set up, but was able to accomplish it with their help. this thing now is able to run any of my video and audio equipment without a lot of effort. thanks Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: David F. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate remote
customer_reviews.text: For AV buffs this is the ultimate remote and has a price to match. Compatible with everything. Easy to set up and very reliable. I had some initial problems with channel selection 'running on' or 'repeating.' This was corrected by customer support and re-synching the unit on the website (where they had made changes). Beware, however, customer support runs out after a year.
customer_reviews.author: JBB32

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect One!
customer_reviews.text: 4th Universal Remote and I should have learned the first time: "Spend the money to get the right one!" The Harmony 1100 works with my Samsung 3D TV, Bose surround, Samsung Blu-Ray, and Apple TV. Mixes RF and IR signals better than any other remote I have found. I operate through a door with no need for an extender with the built in repeater.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie T

customer_reviews.title: The best remote I ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: My family and I love this remote! The setup was a little time consuming, but after that it really does what I want it to do! At one time it stopped working all of a sudden. I had to plug it into the computer, got a software update, since then I never had any problems with it. For me: it's just the perfect remote!
customer_reviews.author: The German

customer_reviews.title: The best and last remote you will ever need !!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this more than 5 stars if I could, this such an amazing product, I have had it for some time now and never been disappointed with it's operation, it is pretty easy to program it thru your PC and customize the icons. When ready just push a selection on the touch screen and it powers up all the devices needed. Fast friendly shipping from the seller, who was very easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: bill larson

customer_reviews.title: Great Touchscreen Remote
customer_reviews.text: I have the Harmony One and love it. Purchased this remote based of the 2yr history of my other remote. I thought the screen resolution would be a tad better, but is not bad considering battery life and cost. If you don't need a large screen the One or the 900 model will suit you well and have near the same functionality. Use the "Compare the Entire Family of Logitech Harmony Remotes" on Amazon to find the one that best fits your needs/taste. Battery is charge hungry and only lasts a few days. Not a major issue as the charger is like a docking station.
customer_reviews.author: friedbread

customer_reviews.title: Still the best choice of programmable remotes on the market
customer_reviews.text: Still one of the most flexible programmable remotes on the market. Programming has a learning curve, and changing existing programs to add new devices requires care and patience. It often takes several rounds to get a sequence exactly right. Once you have it, it is a thing of beauty.
customer_reviews.author: Steve RB

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: When first receiving the remote the look was rather intimidating. However, Logitech makes setup very easy. The first programming worked like a charm. I have used the Harmony remotes for several years but found this model to be particularly effective. One can program the on screen buttons to do just about anything the remote that comes with the unit can do.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Remote
customer_reviews.text: The remote didn't work quite right at first. The installers had come back out and reprogram remote. They said logictech told them it lost programming for one of the devices. It was an easy fix for them. They told me I'd have to run the device a few times before the remote would save the settings. With that said, I didn't think it was as easy as it says it is. I've had the Phillips Pronto remote and never had a problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: DVH

customer_reviews.title: We've got four now...
customer_reviews.text: Working great for us! We're using them in our conference rooms to make things easier for our associates to use in there. Labels the devices and they just click on "Help" and it automatically starts helping them fix the issues. It asks probing questions into the issues to help resolve them (i.e. "Is the TV on?"). Quite nice! The touch display isn't what I'd call fantastic, but it's definitely useful and serves its purpose well. It's an older product at this point, but still supported and works great in both Windows 7 and XP setup environments. All the best to you! ~ Josh
customer_reviews.author: Tom Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous remote!
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from a previous version of a Logitech remote. The touch screen is wonderful and the simplicity of the layout is amazing! This is the remote for people who are overwhelmed by too many options/buttons. The only drawback as far as I can see is the upgrade process from a previous Harmony remote. Most Harmony remotes can be upgraded automatically by the software, thus saving a lot of time and effort in documenting and re-entering all of the information. This one cannot, and it's not made clear that this is the case in the documentation. However, once you "bite the bullet" and do the work, it is WELL WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Cauble

customer_reviews.title: Logitech is logitech
customer_reviews.text: Easy handling, excellent functionality. No complaints, only positives. Excellent workmanship, beautiful, functional, easy to operate. One of the best products I've acquired. Is costly, but worth the value by eliminating all other controls. With logithec quality. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants a good product.
customer_reviews.author: michel fonseca

customer_reviews.title: Cool but just ok
customer_reviews.text: Yes this remote does a lot and looks cool. It is also pretty easy to set up but it isn't really user friendly after that. It's nice being able to hit 1 button and everything comes on but the shape of it doesn't fit in one hand at all. And you spend a lot of time scrolling through screens to find the controls you want.
customer_reviews.author: Ok

customer_reviews.title: Third party vendors should be more responsive to dissatisfied customers
customer_reviews.text: This item had been used and supposedly refurbished; however it did not work and I was not able to get a refund on it as it appeared to have come from a third-party
customer_reviews.author: J A Trott MD

customer_reviews.title: DIshonest support
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace this unit twice due to hardware failures on unit. On both occasions, was told by the Logitech technician that this support has a lifetime warranty. Remote recently went bad again. Contacted support and told that the previous technician misled me and I am currently out of luck. I cannot recommend this remote for the price it is at especially when they have dishonest technicians. I am currently going to pursue a grievance with the BBB about this.
customer_reviews.author: ying stafford

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product from Logitech
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Product from Logitech. What I expected and then some. Works on everything in the house even Bluetooth items with the adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Montytheman

customer_reviews.title: Second time's a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote for my father for christmas. The first remote we received was obviously defective. We worked on it for weeks with no luck. Logitech support isn't much help either. We did everything their troubleshooting/FAQ forum says to do and when we contacted support we had to do it all over again to prove that it simply did not work. Amazon, however has been exceptional! They replaced the remote and it works wonderfully! So don't fret if the first device you get is a bit hard to set up it might be defective. Amazon has been awesome and responsive where the Logitech company was slow, unresponsive and completely unhelpful.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Great for people who use "reader" glasses!
customer_reviews.text: This is generally a great remote. Plusses include the pages of big icons as opposed to a host of tiny buttons. I don't have to grab my reading glasses to use the remote! I bought the RF receiver in addition to the remote, which works fine & allows me to access my components through the wall, but should be included for the premium price this remote fetches. Battery life is good but not stellar. The emitted IR "beam" seems to be broader and stronger than most other universals.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy L. Deshazo

customer_reviews.title: Free at last, free at last
customer_reviews.text: I like to think I'm an intelligent person. However, when it came to owning yet another electronic item into our collection, it also added another remote. I am sick of having to look for specific remotes and remembering which one to turn on for which thing. Enough! Logitech g Has figured it out for me! No more fishing into the couch cushions for me!!! Indispensable!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon89436

customer_reviews.title: Programming is frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: Followed directions and still hard to program. Things would turn off when we wanted them on and vice versa. Put it away, we moved and now I can't find it. Glad I can't because it would just make me mad trying again.
customer_reviews.author: CBRNDeathDealer

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 1100 Universal Remote with Color Touch Screen
customer_reviews.text: I have 7 remotes ... and was able to easily setup each remote for this gadget!! even if they do not have your remote, you can set it up .. it's pretty cool!! You can set up activities .... if you want to watch a movie, you can set it up where you turn on the tv, dvd / blu ray player, and sound system all at the same time. =)
customer_reviews.author: vmk1970

customer_reviews.title: Trouble shooting
customer_reviews.text: I owned the 1000 and had problems with it surfing through channels and the sound increasing or decreasing with one touch. The 1100 is skipping channels and I am now trying to problem solve. It may not be the remote, but it is taking time to figure out the problem. This is not a simple remote to program.
customer_reviews.author: L. Fitzharris

customer_reviews.title: Bad ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: I love the way you can program all sorts of things into this (but it doesnt handle the needs of an XBox!!) but once you have done all that, you can't easily hold it in one hand and flip through the controls like you can with a standard 'candy bar' shaped remote. I am prety disappointed actually. If you want this for surfing the TV - forget it! If you want this for controlling other stuff that doesn't require you to flcik though things constantly then its a great way to put everything in one place - but it still has its foibles with that stuff anyway. Too much money for a bad ergonomic design IMHO
customer_reviews.author: Gilbertenstein

customer_reviews.title: Love this remote
customer_reviews.text: Love this remote. Too bad Logitech decided to discontinue it.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Love it at first.  After some time... Stopped using it.
customer_reviews.text: You will get tired of looking at the remote to find buttons. The conventional button remote is better. It is like replacing a keyboard with a touch screen monitor. Difficult - Especially if you will still need the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Don@Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Harmony Remote 1100
customer_reviews.text: So far, it has been working great for me. All my stuff turns on the way I want. Only little problem is it constantly asks you if everything is ok. Other than that, its great. Way better than 6 remotes. I would suggest a slightly lesser remote if y ou only have 2 or 3 devices. I just happen to like the touch screen display over lots of buttons to press.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Ends confusion with remotes.
customer_reviews.text: Do you have to get your kids or spouse to set up your entertainment system when you switch functions. This solves the problem. You may have to get your family technical guru to program this device but after a few tweaks you'll love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work and terrible support
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions for installation on my iMac. Then connected the remote by bus connector but the imac and remote couldn't communicate. I actually got a logitech tech on the line. he told me that the software disc they sent was outdated and to uninstall it. My iMac wouldnt uninstall and kept giving me an error message. The tech told me that it was my problem and he wouldnt help. Selling me an outdated software was ok though. Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Page

customer_reviews.title: Got two of them
customer_reviews.text: I replace Logitech 1000 with this one about a year a go. Works perfect easy to program, complicated at first but give you self a time, play with it and you going to love it too. The only thing that is missing, is light under hard buttons. The second one I'm programming for my sister.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Czerniewski

customer_reviews.title: Harmony 1100 is worth it for me
customer_reviews.text: I first tried the Harmony One remote and found it well made. Ergonomically, however, I discovered that my fingers were not always able to deal with the touch screen commands accurately. [I have large fingers and hands, so missed strikes were getting annoying.] I then returned that unit and opted for the 1100 which looked like it might take care of those issues. Both devices do what is claimed from a functional standpoint, but the 1100 just handles better for me and I am a happy camper now. Let's hope it lasts for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 1100
customer_reviews.text: Bought new home at the beach with lots of bells and whistles, including built in surround-sound. My tech guy suggested the only thing missing was a universal remote. He suggested the Logitec 1000, but when I checked Amazon.Com I found the Logitec 1100 for the same price I had been been quoted for the 1000 ($100 less than Best Buy). After initial setup (which is simple even for a non tech like me)I wondered why I hadn't gotten a universal remote before. Then my guy reminded me that all universal remotes aren't Harmony Logitec. Now if only it could bring me my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This remote is absolutely amazing, it connects with pretty much everything I own
customer_reviews.text: This remote is absolutely amazing, it connects with pretty much everything I own. Now i have accessibility to all device in one. How sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Edward Lopez Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this remote a few months ago and it just have made my life easier. I used to have 5 remote control for all my components on my room. Now, I only need just this. The configuration is not that hard as some reviews I've read. Will recommend this to everyone. Also the touch screen looks very techy. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Xtrelec max

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Works well with all stereo components; not certain that a less pricey remote could do the same. Our last logitech 1100 only lasted 3 years--more expensive to repair than purchase a new one. Bought this replacement because of the difficult set-up sequence--I only had to replace the main module.
customer_reviews.author: colonel

customer_reviews.title: End all be all? Almost
customer_reviews.text: Ive got everything I can think of hooked up to this. My AC, lights, A/V system etc. This thing makes you lazy lol. Great product. Id recommend to a friend. Wish it had true RF capability though as it would then be the end all be all of remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Snakebitten

customer_reviews.title: Awesome remote
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I lost my regular remote....Logitech is the best. Took less than 30 min to set up and it works great. Love the large screen and the charger.. always know where it is now. I would highly recommend this one. My husband has the Logitech Pro one and I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Runciman

customer_reviews.title: Will never go back to a conventional remote!
customer_reviews.text: Really cool useful device. Bright screen, easy to use buttons. Charge lasts over a week. Programming is a pain in the ass, but once it is done, this thing is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Erik H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Remote
customer_reviews.text: Awesome remote! A little challenging to set up for all my stuff, but once completed, Awesome! Touch screen "hot buttons" make the favorites even mire enjoyable! Definitely worth the investment! Highly recommended for anyone looking to upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: John C. Mims

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: Setup is slow and cumbersome because most of the setups are wizard-driven and this wizard has no "cancel" or "back" button so if you start something in error you have to click through all the way. The device itself has a nice size and feel to it but the screen could be bigger given the size of the chassis. The "activity-based" menu is now my cup of tea. I would like to disable activities and just use the touchscreen to select the device I want to control and then control the device the way I want to. On the Harmony 1100 you are pretty much constrained by the scripted setup wizard and the scripted activity-based way of controlling devices.
customer_reviews.author: Centurion

customer_reviews.title: Function
customer_reviews.text: This remote is great. All you do when it arrives is hook it to a computer with a USB cord. Select the make and enter the model number of all you electronics to be controlled. Then you update the remote. Once you do this, it's ready to use (takes about half hour).
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Richardson

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one
customer_reviews.text: I had a 1000 for several years before the touch screen went out. Hope it doesn't happen with this one. I've not found another remote that does what I want. I run a complex A/V setup with lighting automation. The X10 automation setup online is not very intuitive, however it does work and no other remote I've found does. I give this four stars overall. a bit pricy but if you do complex operations this may be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Love this remote
customer_reviews.text: Used this remote in a retirement home, and the 91-year-olds get it! Does what it says it will do with little compromise. Able to handle oddities in the setup. Programming is an iterative process and there is a bit of a learning curve, but for the programmer, not the end user. For this audience the volume and channel buttons could be a little bigger, but that's it. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Beach

customer_reviews.title: difficult and non-responsive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Harmony One, thinking my family could understand this setup easily. The 1100 works well most of the time, but can a problem because of its size, and touch screen responses. Also, beware the battery, do not leave this unit off it's charging stand after use, or overnight, you'll be going back to your old remotes until the battery is recharged. Update: This thing is so bad that I finally gave it up and went back to my Harmony One, much more responsive, better range, easier to handle.
customer_reviews.author: oanrai

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a product that will reduce the headaches of having multiple remotes, look elsewhere. I'm a tech geek and really wanted to love this remote, but it will cause more headaches than you already have. The biggest challenge was resisting the urge to throw it across the room. Touch screen is total crap. Seems to work better in the middle but the edges don't work at all. Great idea, but it's a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Alton

customer_reviews.title: I like it, dont love it
customer_reviews.text: I like it, dont love it, but like it. It does the job and not to hard to program. I just feel like it should be able to more than what it does. But, its a good remote.
customer_reviews.author: VMY

customer_reviews.title: Think Twice
customer_reviews.text: Think twice. I don't even use mine. Collecting dust. Build Quality feels very good. Not that intuitive. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: ALS patient
customer_reviews.text: My wife has als and could no longer push the buttons on her tv remote. So I got this due to a recomendation of a tv expert because of the touch screen... I paid him to program it for the Tv, channels, dvc, sound system. and it is by far the best thing that has happened to her in a long time. She can now change anything , just by brushing her finger on the screen... I have no idea how hard it is to program.. you may want to hire somebody , I did but this solved our problem.
customer_reviews.author: Elad

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The remote was very easy to program. There is also an enclosed dvd for set up and future reference if needed. Very easy for us to control all of our electronics with just the touch of a finger, and if there is a problem, just tap the "help" icon and it will go through the steps for you to sync everything together again. Kids love it too, because there is no more using 3 remotes to play their video games!!!
customer_reviews.author: mmorse

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought a different model. The interface is so slow.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

product_meta.title: Logitech Harmony 1100 Universal Remote with Color Touch Screen (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
The Logitech Harmony 1100 gives you powerful home-entertainment control through a customizable, 3.5-inch full-color touch screen. Controls are easy to access and are backlit, so you can easily find them in the dark. One-touch, activity-based controls turn on the right devices in the right order with a single command. RF wireless capability lets you control devices without direct line-of-sight, so you can keep components in a closed cabinet or even another room (requires Logitech Harmony RF Extender, sold separately). The on-screen commands are customizable, so you get the commands you want, when you want them. The Harmony 1100 supports more than 5000 brands and over 225,000 devices.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


FEATURES

Logitech Harmony 1100 One touch changes everything—with personalized home theater control
Let the show begin. With customizable color command screens and seamless control of up to 15 home theater components, this touch-screen tablet lets you launch your movies, music, games, videos and favorite stations with a single touch.


CES 2009 Innovations Award
Honoree in Home Theatre Accessories Category
November 2008 
enlarge Harmony 1100
Noteworthy Features • One-touch activity controls turn on all the right A/V components • Stylish tablet design with 3.5" full color touch screen • Customizable screens for personalized entertainment control • Works with 5000+ brands and 225,000+ devices • Rechargeable with included charging station 

enlarge 

One-touch activity controls 
Simply touch icons like “Watch TV” to switch your entertainment Remote turns on all the right devices in the right order—no more cheat sheets Easy for anyone in the family to use 

enlarge 

Sleek recharging station
Keeps your remote charged and ready No batteries to buy or replace Striking piano-black and brushed metal finish adds a touch of luxury to your entertainment room 
enlarge 

Customizable 3.5" color touch-screen
Full color with bright backlighting for an easy read—even in the dark Personalize your screens with customizable commands, favorite channel icons and more 
enlarge 

One controls all
Universal control of up to 15 video, audio, music and gaming devices Supports over 5,000 brands and 225,000 devices with new ones added every day Works with devices you own today and add tomorrow 
Learn More >

enlarge
RF wireless support for hidden devices
Add a Logitech Harmony RF Extender (sold separately) to control components neatly hidden away inside a closed cabinet or closet. 

enlarge
Quick and simple setup
Connect the remote to your computer—online software guides you through setup No need to enter endless equipment codes into your remote Live customer support is ready to help if you need it 
Learn More >

COMPATIBILITY

What's in the box? Harmony 1100 remote control Charging station USB cable AC adapter Lithium-ion battery Installation CD Quick-start guide Features guide 1-year limited hardware warranty What you need:
Windows-compatible PC Windows 2000, Windows XP, Windows Vista or Windows 7 USB port CD-ROM drive Internet access 
Mac computer Macintosh OS X 10.3 – 10.5 USB port CD-ROM drive Internet access 
COMPARE

Which Logitech Harmony Remote Is Right For You? 

Harmony 650
For control that's bright and brilliant Harmony 700
For simple control that's always charged and ready Harmony One
For simple, stylish touch-screen control Harmony 900
For complete control of devices you can't see Harmony 1100
For personalized control of your home theater system 
Harmony Link
Turns your iPad, iPhone, iPod touch or Android smartphone into a touch screen remote Control Features Harmony 650 Harmony 700 Harmony One Harmony 900 Harmony 1100 Harmony Link TV listings with one-touch access to shows iPad only Tablet design with 3.5" touch screen Customizable screens for more powerful personalization RF control for devices inside closed cabinets RF system included RF Wireless Extender sold separately IR mini blaster included Touch screen On mobile device Rechargeable 
Docking Station 
Docking Station 
Docking Station A/C powered Bright LCD color display On mobile device One-touch controls for multiple activities Always growing database of 225,000+ devices—works with what you owntoday and tomorrow Simple online setup with PC or Mac (Windows XP, Vista or 7 or Intel-based Mac OS X 10.4.8 or later) Live support if you hit a snag Help button so you're never stuck 1-year warranty How many devices can it control? 5 6 15 15 15 8 

ACCESSORIES
Add to your Harmony remote and do even more.

Logitech Harmony RF Wireless Extender Control devices you can't see—like your stereo hidden inside a closed cabinet—when you use this plug-and-play wireless extender with your Harmony 1100 remote. Logitech Harmony Adapter for PlayStation 3
Get one-touch control of all 51 PS3 functions using any Harmony remote. The Bluetooth wireless connection lets you access your PlayStation 3 games and movies without leaving the couch.
feature_bullets: RF wireless capability. Support for 5,000+ brands and 225,000+ devices

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars728 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
